intro: Elaeocarpus macrocerus subsp. heinrichii, commonly known as the Philippine rosewood, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its ornate, fragrant flowers and dark, dense wood. The plant typically grows in lowland to montane forests, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and elliptical in shape, while its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Due to its high-quality timber, it is also valued for its ecological and economic importance in its native habitat.
